transportAdvice: Salt Lake City has a public transit system including light rail and bus lines that connect downtown and many tourist areas, making it reasonably easy to get around without a car. Taxis and ride-hail vehicles are widely available, and the downtown core is walkable, though a car is recommended for reaching mountain resorts and outlying attractions.
